title: Can Hypnosis Be Forced Upon Someone and How Effective Is Resistance Against It?
first_phrase: In the last part of this text, the author discusses the power an hypnotizer has over their subject and the potential consequences of this absolute control. They explain how some individuals are more susceptible to hypnotism and how it is important to protect them from potential abusers. The author suggests that suggesting an absolute ban on anyone else being able to hypnotize the individual is one solution to this issue. Before delving into the scientific implications, the author acknowledges the delicate nature of the topic.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to take precautions when dealing with individuals who possess the ability to enter hypnosis, as this ability can be abused. One effective way to ensure that such individuals are protected is to suggest that no one can hypnotize them for a specified period. While the scientific theory behind hypnosis remains unclear, it is essential to prioritize the consent of the subject, and to exercise caution in the use of hypnotic suggestions.
